meanings.definition: Slightly sour or acidic in taste.
meanings.sent1: The lemonade had an acidulous flavor.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar had an acidulous taste.
meanings.sent3: She made an acidulous face after tasting the sour candy.
meanings.sent4: His words had an acidulous effect on her mood.
meanings.sent5: The acidulous apple made her pucker her lips.

meanings.definition: Sharp or biting in manner or tone.
meanings.sent1: Her acidulous remarks left a bitter impression.
meanings.sent2: The critic's review was filled with acidulous comments.
meanings.sent3: His acidulous humor always caught people off guard.
meanings.sent4: The argument took an acidulous turn.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's acidulous tone made the students uneasy.
